story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0100:
Today’s the day I pay you back for all the times
you’ve beaten me. Come on, Ho-Oh! Don’t
hold back!
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0200:
Sorry, but that’s not going to happen just yet.
Dragonite! Counter their attack!
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0300: Great battle. You almost had us.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0400: It doesn’t matter. A loss is a loss.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0500:
Still, that was really close. There were a bunch of
moments where even I was worried.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0600: Really? I couldn’t tell at all...
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0700:
Well... If we let it show, we’d just be revealing to
you what our weaknesses are.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0800:
Exactly. You know, your team did an excellent job
working together.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_0900:
It took Xatu and Umbreon working together just to
deal with Feraligatr’s strength...
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_1000:
and I could hardly find an opening with that
teamwork your two Ho-Oh were showing.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_1100:
Hear that, Silver? Sounds like we make a pretty
decent team.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_1200:
Hmph. I’ll get you back for this eventually. You’d
better be ready when I come back for
another rematch.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_1500: I’d like to ask you a question, Silver.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_1600:
I heard from Ethan that when you two first met,
you were the kind of guy who’d do anything to
get stronger.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_2000: Yeah, I did. What of it?
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_2100: I was wondering why you changed your mind.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_2200:
You were doing things that way because you felt
it would make you stronger, right?
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_2300:
If you’d kept going down that path, don’t you think
you might’ve come out stronger for it?
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_2600:
Back then, I thought that I could be the strongest
Trainer as long as I had the strongest Pokémon.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_2700:
But even when I had the strongest Pokémon,
there were still people I couldn’t beat.
That’s why I changed.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_2800:
I still don’t completely understand why I lost
back then...
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_2900: But I think I’m starting to get it now.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_3000:
Does that have to do with relying on others?
Or maybe...connections?
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_3100:
At the very least, a strong connection with your
Pokémon is a must.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_3200:
That said, I hate weak Trainers who think they’re
big and tough as long as they’re in a group.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_3300:
I see... Thanks, Silver. Sorry for asking that out
of the blue.
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_3600:
(Which means...as long as I have a connection,
I can use any means necessary to get stronger?)
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_3800: I don’t see a Trainer around... Why’s it all alone?
story_teamrocket_02_02000/2401_1201_3900: Hold on... It looks like it’s in pain.
